metadata.Title: CVE-2016-5420 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
curl and libcurl before 7.50.1 do not check the client certificate when choosing the TLS connection to reuse, which might allow remote attackers to hijack the authentication of the connection by leveraging a previously created connection with a different client certificate.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-5420` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

curl - 7.47.0-1ubuntu2.1
libcurl3 - 7.47.0-1ubuntu2.1
libcurl3-gnutls - 7.47.0-1ubuntu2.1
libcurl3-nss - 7.47.0-1ubuntu2.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: seth-arnold> when built against NSS another patch is needed, see http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2016/09/05/1 for information http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2016/09/05/7

criterions.comment: curl package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.47.0-1ubuntu2.1').
